1.text: Paul, apostle, not from men nor through man, but through Jesus Christ, and God [the] Father who raised him from among [the] dead,

2.text: and all the brethren with me, to the assemblies of Galatia.

3.text: Grace to you, and peace, from God [the] Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.text: who gave himself for our sins, so that he should deliver us out of the present evil world, according to the will of our God and Father;

5.text: to whom [be] glory to the ages of ages. Amen.

6.text: I wonder that ye thus quickly change, from him that called you in Christ’s grace, to a different gospel,

7.text: which is not another [one]; but there are some that trouble you, and desire to pervert the glad tidings of the Christ.

8.text: But if even we or an angel out of heaven announce as glad tidings to you [anything] besides what we have announced as glad tidings to you, let him be accursed.

9.text: As we have said before, now also again I say, If any one announce to you as glad tidings [anything] besides what ye have received, let him be accursed.

10.text: For do I now seek to satisfy men or God? or do I seek to please men? If I were yet pleasing men, I were not Christ’s bondman.

11.text: But I let you know, brethren, [as to] the glad tidings which were announced by me, that they are not according to man.

12.text: For neither did I receive them from man, neither was I taught [them], but by revelation of Jesus Christ.

13.text: For ye have heard [what was] my conversation formerly in Judaism, that I excessively persecuted the assembly of God, and ravaged it;

14.text: and advanced in Judaism beyond many [my] contemporaries in my nation, being exceedingly zealous of the doctrines of my fathers.

15.text: But when God, who set me apart [even] from my mother’s womb, and called [me] by his grace,

16.text: was pleased to reveal his Son in me, that I may announce him as glad tidings among the nations, immediately I took not counsel with flesh and blood,

17.text: nor went I up to Jerusalem to those [who were] apostles before me; but I went to Arabia, and again returned to Damascus.

18.text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to make acquaintance with Peter, and I remained with him fifteen days;

19.text: but I saw none other of the apostles, but James the brother of the Lord.

20.text: Now what I write to you, behold, before God, I do not lie.

21.text: Then I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.

22.text: But I was unknown personally to the assemblies of Judaea which [are] in Christ;

23.text: only they were hearing that he who persecuted us formerly now announces the glad tidings of the faith which formerly he ravaged:

24.text: and they glorified God in me.
